result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronney A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronney A Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronney A Smith was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Ronney A Smith was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ronney A Smith in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:05 PM. Burns - resolved - provides court with plea questionnaire - plead to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, counts #3 and #4 will be DRI, count #5 - dismissed, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence, place on probation for 12 with conditions: court costs on each court, AODA, 30 hours of community service, no contact with Mole Lake BP Gas Station, any and all other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P. State agrees - restitution will be $109.20 plus VW surcharge of $10.92 totalling $120.12. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4 and dismisses count #5. Smith pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Court goes off record to review complaint. State - dismiss tracking citation - follow joint recommendation. Burns - follow joint recommendation - 10 days credit if revoked - dismiss traffic ticket. Smith makes comment, remorseful. Court dismisses 15TR280. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence, place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: court costs on each court - paid thru probation, 30 hours of community service - total, no contact with Mole Lake BP Gas Station, any and all other conditions as deemed appropriate by P&P, restitution of $109.20 plus VW surcharge of $10.92 for a total restitution amount of $120.12 - paid thru probation, credit for 10 days only if revoked, if costs and conditions are completed within 6 months and with approval of P&P agent - the Court will allow early discharge/termination from probation, give DNA testing and explains enpungement of that, right to appeal, adjourned.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victims. Not to enter Mole Lake C-Store.

Defendant Ronney A Smith in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 8:38 AM. State moves to dismiss 15CF69 in its entirety at this time, refund bond posted. State - 15CF115 - PH is being waived. Burns provides court with waiver of PH form. Court goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, reviews complaint, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Court will track 15TR280 with 15CF115. State will file Information that mirrors the complaint. Burns will proceed to ARGN, will waive reading of any Information filed, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, refund bond on 15CF69, set for FPT. Burns addresses bond. Court amends bond on 15CF115 to $3000 signature bond with same conditions, refund bond posted. Court dismisses 15CF69 without prejudice.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Called at 10:17 AM. Ronney Smith appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. Burns has asked that this matter be put on the calendar for a bond review. Burns makes argument for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - requests at least $500 cash bond for stated reasons. Burns makes argument for signature bond again. Court - bond - $2000 signature bond with same conditions of no consumption of alcohol, no contact with the victim and no entrance into the Mole Lake C-Store. Set for INIT on 8/25/15 at 8:30 AM. Burns asks that this case, when filed, also be assigned to a different Judge as he has filed a RFS on 15CF72. Court now has concerns with changing the bond to signature bond, discussion held. Court changes bond back to $500 cash and transfer the case to Juge O'Melia when filed for judicial economy as he is the Judge on 15CF72, State will file the case ASAP. Burns can ask for bond modification with Judge O'Melia.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victim and not to enter into Mole Lake C-Store
